etymologies: mid 19th century. From Urdu gulmohar, gulmohr, colloquial pronunciation of gulmuhr from gul rose, flower (from Persian gul) + muhr seal

definitions: A tree with scarlet or orange flowers and feathery pinnate leaves, Delonix regia (family Leguminosae), native to Madagascar and widely planted as an ornamental in tropical regions. Also called (royal) peacock flower, royal poinciana, flamboyant.
